channel.title: Psp
channel.description:
Well, I'm thinking of buying a PSP but I have some questions first. Do you guys even think that the psp is worth buying? There are a load of games for it but you do have a small screen. Also I heard about being able to play downloaded games, and that is quite a must because I don't like paying over and over for new games. I've read somewhere about making you battery 'pandora' or whatever, but I don't want to fuck it up if I get it.
Thanks in advance.

PSP is the best portable console out there, you must be crazy not to buy it

[/quote]

item.title: Psp
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:21, topic:212437”]Seems they released the psp fw 4.00 which includes better video playing features and a google search feature straight from the xmb, one thing i tried today too is that i enabled internet remote start on my ps3 and registered my psp with my ps3 and then went down to our tesco which has a internet cafe part of it and could connect easily to my ps3 and watch all my films that was on my ps3’s hard drive and play the ps1 classics i downloaded from the playstation store also off my ps3s hard drive, (First rainbow six, theme hospital etc) and it streamed them all fine with no lag at all. So i’ll be taking my psp whenever i go on long trips or abroad. So theres one plus for the psp (if you have a ps3).

[/hijack].[/quote]

owow

I have to try that, sounds great.

Read full topic

item.title: Psp
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

I have had mine for 2 years but I cant use it as my MS is broken

But yes the extra battery will be worth it. www.pspupdates.com is where I go for all of my PSP homebrew

Read full topic

item.title: Psp
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

My warranty kicked the bucket a while ago. I’ve yet to feel the urge to fix it myself. I don’t want to have to pay $25.00 to fix it though. I’m sure when I get a PS3 I’ll probably fix it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Psp
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

My screen broke too once, back when i played on it. All i had to do is ring up sony and they came in two days and did a swap for a reconditioned one for free (as the screen like, blew up from the inside).

Seems they released the psp fw 4.00 which includes better video playing features and a google search feature straight from the xmb, one thing i tried today too is that i enabled internet remote start on my ps3 and registered my psp with my ps3 and then went down to our tesco which has a internet cafe part of it and could connect easily to my ps3 and watch all my films that was on my ps3’s hard drive and play the ps1 classics i downloaded from the playstation store also off my ps3s hard drive, (First rainbow six, theme hospital etc) and it streamed them all fine with no lag at all. So i’ll be taking my psp whenever i go on long trips or abroad. So theres one plus for the psp (if you have a ps3).

[/hijack].

Read full topic

item.title: Psp
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

It has to be Originals, they patch the little hacks with the Platinum Editions. Just do Pandoras Battery, it’s the Fail safe technique to downgrading, in fact, it works so well you can fix bricked PSPs. $12.00 for a battery isn’t bad at all. And is worth it.

I’ve had my PSP since the day is came out. But about a year ago my screen broke, so I have yet to fix it. It’s just kind of laying around.

Read full topic

Yea, there is this pack that contains stuff like an extra battery and other stuff, I’d might buy that. But I also read something about being able to downgrade with Gta: Liberty city stories. Now I have that game, and it gives me the option to upgrade to 2.60, but I don’t know what it upgrades.

item.title: Psp
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Ok this sucks, I have firmware 3.90 on my psp and as far as I can find anything on the net the only way to to downgrade it is via a pandora battery. But that means I can only boot it up with an adaptor, and the reason I bought it is that I want to play games in the bus or in the car.

Read full topic

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:9, topic:212437”]RIP - the PSP is a lot of fun, and pretty useful for long journeys, and commuting about. Some games are shit, whereas some games are pretty fun. I’d get one.

Sorry to hijack, but does anyone know how much I could sell a 2 year old PSP, good - ok condition, with 8 games and 3 movies for?[/quote]
Go to EB or gamestop and ask about a trade in.

Read full topic

item.description:

RIP - the PSP is a lot of fun, and pretty useful for long journeys, and commuting about. Some games are shit, whereas some games are pretty fun. I’d get one.

Sorry to hijack, but does anyone know how much I could sell a 2 year old PSP, good - ok condition, with 8 games and 3 movies for?
